title: Failed Package Delivery
description: A fake SMS about a failed delivery with a suspicious tracking link.
context: You receive a text message on your phone about a package delivery. You are not currently expecting any deliveries.

content.message_text: USPS: Your package could not be delivered due to incomplete address information. Please update your details within 12 hours or the package will be returned. Track here: http://usps-redelivery.track-pkg.co/update?ref=99281

red_flags.label: Fake tracking domain
red_flags.detail: The real USPS website is usps.com. The link 'usps-redelivery.track-pkg.co' is a lookalike domain designed to appear legitimate.

red_flags.label: 12-hour deadline creates urgency
red_flags.detail: USPS does not impose such short deadlines via SMS. This pressure tactic is designed to make you act without thinking.

red_flags.label: Unexpected notification
red_flags.detail: You are not expecting a delivery. Unsolicited messages about packages you didn't order are a common phishing vector.

red_flags.label: Unknown phone number
red_flags.detail: USPS uses short codes or their official number for notifications, not random phone numbers.

actions.label: Tap the tracking link
actions.feedback: Dangerous! This link leads to a phishing site that will ask for your personal details, address, and possibly payment information.

actions.label: Call the sender number back
actions.feedback: Calling back could connect you to a scam call center. Never call numbers from suspicious messages.

actions.label: Go to the official USPS website directly
actions.feedback: Smart move! Always navigate to official websites by typing the URL directly in your browser, never through links in messages.

actions.label: Delete the message and block the number
actions.feedback: Correct! Deleting and blocking prevents future contact. You can also forward suspicious SMS to 7726 (SPAM) to report it.

Always go to official websites directly, not through message links
